snippet: Life for the McSween family, normally filled with doctor’s appointments, lab tests and operations for their sick 7-year-old, was turned upside down when both parents’ income dried up.
abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of Brooklyn and Queens, one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Natilee McSween and her husband, whose daughter Megan was born with severe kidney ailment, cover rental arrears, allowing them to remain in their Brooklyn apartment.
lead_paragraph: Life for the McSween family, normally filled with doctor’s appointments, lab tests and operations for their sick 7-year-old, was turned upside down when both parents’ income dried up.

headline.print_headline: Raising a Sick Daughter Was Hard Enough, Then Both Parents Lost Their Jobs
headline.main: Raising a Sick Daughter Was Hard Enough, Then They Lost Their Jobs

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
